parameters.name: DisplayName
parameters.description: The display name of the user that you want to query. Only exact match is supported.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description:
The ID of the bastion host whose users you want to query.

>  You can call the [DescribeInstances](~~153281~~) operation to query the bastion host ID.

parameters.name: Mobile
parameters.description: The mobile phone number of the user that you want to query. Only exact match is supported.

parameters.name: PageSize
parameters.description:
The number of entries per page.\
Valid values: 1 to 100. Default value: 20. If you leave this parameter empty, 20 entries are returned on each page.

>  We recommend that you do not leave this parameter empty.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description:
The region ID of the bastion host whose users you want to query.

>  For more information about the mapping between region IDs and region names, see [Regions and zones](~~40654~~).

parameters.name: Source
parameters.description:
The type of the user that you want to query. Valid values:

*   **Local**: a local user.
*   **Ram**: a Resource Access Management (RAM) user.
*   **AD**: an Active Directory (AD)-authenticated user.
*   **LDAP**: a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP)-authenticated user.

parameters.name: SourceUserId
parameters.description:
The unique ID of the user that you want to query. Only exact match is supported.

>  This parameter uniquely identifies a RAM user of the bastion host. This parameter is valid if **Source** is set to **Ram**. You can call the [ListUsers](~~28684~~) operation in RAM to obtain the unique ID of the user from the **UserId** response parameter.

parameters.name: UserGroupId
parameters.description:
The ID of the user group to which the user you want to query belongs.

>  You can call the [ListUserGroups](~~204509~~) operation to query the user group ID.

parameters.name: UserName
parameters.description: The logon name of the user that you want to query. Only exact match is supported.

parameters.name: UserState
parameters.description:
The state of the user that you want to query. Valid values:

*   **Normal**: The user is in normal state.
*   **Frozen**: The user is locked.
*   **Expired**: The user has expired.
